Definition: the full and complete title

display name concatenated from First Name, Last Name Prefix, and Last Name. The name of a culture, such as "Egyptian" or "Mayan," may be displayed here when individual contributors cannot be identified.
Range: Free text linked to artist record; could be more than one

Definition: display name concatenated from First Name, Last Name Prefix, and Last Name. The name of a culture, such as "Egyptian" or "Mayan," may be displayed here when individual contributors cannot be identified.
Range: Free text linked to artist record; could be more than one

Definition: natural language entry and display of the object’s creation date and any modifications to the date to indicate uncertain scholarship

Local Name: Class 1 IF value="Decorative Arts"; otherwise Class 2
Table/System Name: Class_system IF IF value="Decorative Arts"; otherwise Class1
Definition: A subset of terms that group or classify like objects together based on similar attributes.
the material/media & support of the object
The five components of the Accession number concatenated in a single string
The stakeholder within ND that stewards the resource.
Example Term: Snite Museum of Art/Raclin Murphy Museum of Art

Definition: an identification, description, or interpretation of what is depicted in and by a work or image
Example Term: AAT:<Top of the AAT hierarchies>:<Agents Facet>:<People>:people:<people by occupation>:<people in the humanities>:<people in religion and related occupations>:people in religion:spirits:angel
Range: Text string Getty AAT or IA

Definition: This field catalogues the kind of copyright held by the agent identified as the Copyright Holder.
Range: Controlled text string [Public domain, Copyright, Copyright under license, Copyright NEL]

Definition: This field records the copyright statement which is the legal rights to reproduce, publish, sell, or distribute the media included in the record
Example Term: Photographie J.H. Lartigue © Ministère de la Culture - France/A.A.J.H.L

Definition: An element for information about conditions that affect the availability of the materials being described.
further category of objects by function, medium, or art historical tradition
Example Term: Panel painting, boudoir print, carte de visite, Windsor chair

Definition: dimensions of the object
A formal public credit statement about a transfer of ownership, acquisition, source, or sponsorship of an item
Example Term: Gift of Mrs. John T. McCutcheon

Definition: Description of the object that will be published on the online catalog.
Example Term: These pictures are part of a series of famous mythological paintings by Titian. They were painted for King Philip II of Spain when the artist was at the height of his powers. The subjects were based on the Roman poet Ovid's Metamorphoses – Titian himself referred to them as 'poesie' (poems).

Local Name: Continent + Country + State-Province + County + City + Historic
Definition: The place(s) which are the focus of the content.
Relationships among objects in the collection
A field to record the certainty of attribution of this object to the Maker
Example Term: e.g., "school of," "circle of," "in the manner of," "follower of."

Rules: no display, no search, no facet
Definition: The date the record was last modified.

Rules: no display, no search, no facet
Definition: The time of day when the record was last modified.
Specifies that this surrogate's image should be used as the primary object image

Rules: no display, no search, no facet
Definition: Filepath of the image file

Rules: no display, no search, no facet
Definition: The filename of the image file

Rules: no display, no search, no facet
Definition: The type of contribution made by the artist/maker, or the role he/she had in the process of creation or manufacture
This field contains information about the geopolitical entity that claims the artist, expressed as a nationality
artist’s birth and death date
